the visionary conqueror was soon reminded of his dependence and servitude. The friends of Tarik had effectually stated his services

and wrongs: at the court of Damascus, the proceedings of Musa were blamed, his intentions were suspected, and his delay in corn- plying with the first invitation was chastised by an harsher and more peremptory summons. An intrepid meffenger of the caliph entered his camp at Lugo in Gallicia, and in the presence of the Saracens and Christiane arrested the bridle of his horse. His own loyaky, or that of his troops, inculcated the duty of obedience : and his disgrace was alleviated by the recal of his rival, and the permis- sion of investing with his two governments his two sons, Abdallah and Abdelaziz.
